newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti shares slide after H1 sales slip.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti shares slide after H1 sales slip.

text.p: Shares in information technology group Olivetti slipped on Friday following first half 1997 results late Thursday which showed that sales had continued to slide at the company, dealers said.
Olivetti shares were off 4.58 percent at 644 lire on the Milan bourse by 0945 GMT.

"The indebtedness is a little better than expected, while sales are worse and this makes the objective of seven trillion lire for the whole year difficult to reach," said telecoms analyst Alberto Rolla at brokers Pasfin.
Olivetti said late Thursday its consolidated revenues (excluding mobile phone consortium Omnitel) for the first half of 1997 stood at 3.1 trillion lire, down 10.4 percent on the same period in 1996.

The group said in a statement following a board meeting its total net financing requirement at the end of the first half this year was about 2.5 trillion lire, stable on the 2.455 trillion level at the end of June 1996.
The company added that Rodolfo De Benedetti, son of former Olivetti chairman Carlo De Benedetti, had resigned from the board.
